triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The paper builds on reinforcement learning as the foundational ML paradigm for learning from interaction with environments.

triples.name: Deep reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The paper addresses challenges in deep reinforcement learning algorithms for offline learning from fixed batch data.

triples.name: Q-learning
triples.relevance: DQN is a deep learning variant of Q-learning, which the paper demonstrates has extrapolation issues in batch settings.

triples.name: DQN
triples.relevance: The paper identifies DQN as an example of off-policy algorithm that fails when learning from uncorrelated data.

triples.name: Actor-critic algorithm
triples.relevance: DDPG is an actor-critic method that the paper demonstrates also fails in batch-constrained settings.

triples.name: Offline learning
triples.relevance: The core problem the paper addresses is learning from fixed, offline batch data without further environment interaction.

triples.name: Explorationâ€“exploitation dilemma
triples.relevance: The paper's batch-constrained approach addresses exploration issues by constraining actions to stay near the data distribution.

triples.name: Batch learning
triples.relevance: The paper proposes batch-constrained reinforcement learning, a novel class of algorithms for learning from fixed batch data without environment interaction.
